decks.notes: The key concept of this deck revolves around using the powerful UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Mine) to ramp up mana quickly and search for powerful finishers like Wurmcoil Engine, Iona, Shield of Emeria, Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, and Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite. The deck focuses on control elements with removal spells like Path to Exile and sweepers like Wrath of God, while also utilizing card draw and selection with spells like Gifts Ungiven and Thirst for Knowledge. The deck aims to control the game tempo and overwhelm opponents with powerful threats.

The main concept of this Modern Combo-Twin Exarch deck is to quickly assemble the Splinter Twin combo with Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to generate infinite tokens for a game-ending attack. The deck also includes control elements like Remand and Spell Snare to protect the combo pieces, as well as efficient removal like Lightning Bolt and Electrolyze. Snapcaster Mage provides additional value by flashing back key spells, while cards like Vendilion Clique and Spellskite offer disruption and protection. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently assemble its combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck revolves around using Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling to search for specific creatures and create powerful combos. It aims to control the board with removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Thoughtseize while also having a toolbox of creatures to choose from for different situations. The deck uses mana dorks like Noble Hierarch and Birds of Paradise to ramp up and cast its higher cost creatures. Overall, the deck focuses on using the synergy between its creatures to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent in a 1 vs 1 format.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deal damage to the opponent by playing aggressive red cards like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Flames of the Blood Hand. With a low mana curve and efficient burn spells, the deck aims to apply pressure early on and finish off the opponent before they can stabilize. The creatures in the deck, such as Goblin Guide and Hellspark Elemental, also contribute to the aggressive game plan by attacking and dealing damage directly. The deck's strategy is to win the game as fast as possible through aggressive plays and burn spells.

This UWx Midrange control deck focuses on optimal board control through removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt, as well as counterspells such as Remand and Cryptic Command. The deck also utilizes powerful threats like Geist of Saint Traft and Restoration Angel to pressure opponents. The combination of card advantage from Snapcaster Mage and disruptive creatures like Vendilion Clique allows the deck to outvalue opponents in the long game. The inclusion of Keranos, God of Storms provides additional inevitability and card advantage to close out games.

The deck is focused on quickly deploying a board of artifact creatures like Ornithopter and Vault Skirge, equipping them with Cranial Plating and using Galvanic Blast for reach to overwhelm your opponent. Steel Overseer and Master of Etherium provide buffs to your artifact creatures, while Etched Champion provides protection from targeted removal spells. The lands are optimized to support the deck's synergy with artifacts, allowing for explosive and aggressive plays to quickly close out the game.

The deck focuses on using creatures with various abilities to create powerful combos and toolbox options. By utilizing cards like Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling, the player can search for specific creatures to fit the situation and assemble game-winning combos. This deck aims to control the board through a combination of creature removal, life gain, and creature recursion, while also providing a solid beatdown strategy with efficient creatures like Noble Hierarch and Kitchen Finks. The key concept revolves around out-valuing opponents by generating synergies and overwhelming them with a versatile toolbox of creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game using a combination of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw until you can assemble the necessary lands to play Scapeshift. Once Scapeshift is cast, the deck aims to fetch multiple Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle lands and deal lethal damage to the opponent. This strategy requires careful mana management, timing of spells, and decision-making to outmaneuver the opponent and win the game through a powerful combo finish.

The main idea of this deck is to use Birthing Pod to tutor for a variety of creatures with different abilities, forming a toolbox of options to deal with different situations. By using cards like Chord of Calling and Abrupt Decay, the deck can search for specific answers or threats when needed. The deck also includes combo pieces like Melira, Syvlan Outcast and Murderous Redcap to create infinite loops for victory. Gavony Township provides a way to pump up creatures for a strong end game. Overall, the deck aims to be versatile and adaptive in order to outmaneuver opponents.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board with discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek, while deploying threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant to pressure the opponent. The deck also includes removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Maelstrom Pulse to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is carefully constructed to support both black and green cards, with Treetop Village providing additional aggression. The deck aims to control the game early on and close out with powerful creatures and planeswalkers.

This deck utilizes a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for and played using Birthing Pod and Chord of Calling. The creatures in the deck provide a variety of utility and disruptive abilities, with the potential for combos such as Melira, Sylvok Outcast and Murderous Redcap. The deck focuses on assembling powerful synergies and value engines to outmaneuver opponents and control the game. The mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility, allowing for smooth gameplay and access to various colors of mana for the diverse range of creatures in the deck.

The deck focuses on controlling the game by countering threats, removing creatures, and generating card advantage. It utilizes a mixture of counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The creatures in the deck provide value through card advantage, blinking effects, and combo potential with Kiki-Jiki. The land base supports the control elements of the deck with utility lands and the ability to fix mana for the multiple colors needed. The aim is to outvalue the opponent and eventually win through incremental advantage.

This Merfolk deck focuses on aggressive board presence and tempo control. By using creatures like Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to pump up other Merfolk creatures, combined with Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play at instant speed, this deck aims to quickly overwhelm opponents. Spreading Seas can disrupt mana bases while Sygg, River Guide provides protection for key creatures. Additionally, Cryptic Command offers versatility for controlling the board and gaining card advantage. Overall, this deck aims to quickly establish a dominant board presence and control the tempo of the game.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly accumulate poison counters on your opponent by using efficient and aggressive creatures with infect, such as Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, while utilizing pump spells like Mutagenic Growth and Might of Old Krosa to give them the extra power needed to deal lethal damage. By combining these elements with protection spells like Vines of Vastwood and Apostle's Blessing, the deck aims to win the game in a swift and decisive manner before the opponent has a chance to react.

This deck focuses on utilizing the combination of Splinter Twin with either Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create an infinite combo that generates a large number of tokens or deals a lethal amount of direct damage to the opponent. The deck also includes control elements such as Remand, Lightning Bolt, Izzet Charm, and Cryptic Command to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Snapcaster Mage allows for flexibility in reusing powerful spells, while Tectonic Edge and spell lands provide additional utility and mana fixing.
